Reviews.Title: “Elisa runs a great property!”
Reviews.Author: Sully94534
Reviews.Content: Ester or Bella at the front desk, Elisa the GM, great property. Stayed here two nights this month already. Clean, spacious rooms. Great free breakfast. Fair value, good location. Make sure you get a room that the bathroom for doesn't open toward the main entrance of the room, makes for tricky departure sometimes. Will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Lower Price Alternative to Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: idahotraveler50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during March, 2012. We travel to San Diego often and decided to try a hotel away from the downtown area. The Sorrento area is just minutes away from downtown San Diego, but is also close to Torrey Pines and La Jolla. We were happy with our choice. The rooms were clean, the staff was nice, and even though our room faced Lusk Street, it was very quiet. Breakfast was the usual Holiday Inn Express fare. The pool was kind of small, but the kids using it seemed to be having lots of fun! My only complaint about our room on the fourth floor was that we couldn't open the window. This necessitated turning on the air conditioning unit, which was noisy. Also, the chair in the "business area" needs to be replaced. It's like sitting in a hole! One of our favorite excursions while visiting San Diego was a visit to the wineries in Temecula, which we reached via Highway 78, traveling through the little town of Ramona, famous for avocado and citrus orchards, wine grape production, and the most delicious cinnamon rolls I ever eaten at The Ramona Cafe. If you love visiting gardens, you must see the San Diego Botanical Garden, located in Encinitas. It's a very restful garden with lovely California native plants, magnificent palms, and huge bamboo groves. For the kids there's a large interactive children's garden that's fun for adults too.

Reviews.Title: “Windows Wont Open”
Reviews.Author: longball44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here five days in March 2012. One problem was that, for the first time in our hotel/motel experiences, we could not open a window to get fresh air. Yes having the AC on all the time drowns out any road or freeway noise, but after awhile it would be nice to be able to get some fresh air without having to take the elevator down and run outside. No matter what floor you are on, most hotels have their windows set you can open them, at least, three or four inches. We went next door to Country Inn & Suites By Carlson and found the same thing, top floor windows that wouldn't open at all. Having a Chili's restaurant directly across from the hotel was a plus for us. We were able to order online and, within minutes, walk over a pick up our dinner at the Chili's To Go door. During the week there was very few folks at breakfast, but come the weekend there were so many people and families having eating that they there was no tables available and they kept running out of food. Even though there were signs that said "Trays Available" the staff told me "No, there are no trays." We thought, if there were trays you could, at least, snag some breakfast and take it back up to your room. Not the case here. Hotel doors are heavy and will slam shut if you let them. Please think about the other guests and make sure your door closes quietly when you enter or exit. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Tom53151
Reviews.Content: Hotel desk manager Ester deserves a special thank for her attentiveness to myself . She never gets frustrated or loses her smile even with rude hotel guests. This entire hotel staff will do everything possible to resolve any problem there, though do not expect such after check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent breakfast, free WiFi Internet in room”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Derail
Reviews.Content: The Sorrento Valley is close to a major highway and byways, easy drive to Lajolla, the airport, zoo or downtown. However less costly than staying downtown. Also, very quiet neighborhood. Helpful staff. This is the place to go to spend about 10$ extra per night but be in a hotel instead of a motel. Small pool, but even if big I wouldn't have used it. I'm nearly six feet tall, and I fit under the shower head with room to spare, I appreciate large bathrooms, room for two adults.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for my purposes”
Reviews.Author: Lalya B
Reviews.Content: I always stay in Holiday Inn Express Sorrento Valley when I'm in San Diego, they always welcome me with a bag of goodies that at least make me feel good... All personnel is always very nice and I would like to give a special thank to Elisa Santos for all her help and as always she is very helpful, I really appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but you need to be a gymnist to reach the toilet paper.”
Reviews.Author: miami33029
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast is unbeatable, and the employees are probably the nicest people of any hotel I have stayed in before. I'll keep coming back. My only comment (and I've seen this in other Holiday Inns) is the toilet paper. I don't think anyone who builds these hotels has ever sat down and used the toilet. If they had, they would hate it. You have to be a contortionist to be able to reach the toilet paper behind you when you are done. To make it worse, there is this stupid cosmetic metal shield that hangs over the roll which is supposed to look nice. The only problem is that it rips every single sheet of toilet paper one at a time because the toilet paper is thin... So by the time I am done going, my wrist, back and neck all hurt from trying to reach around and tear off one sheet at a time. Seriously, I am surprised that guests haven't tried to rip the thing off. I tried to put it behind the roll, but it didn't work. What's funny is that I asked other people at breakfast, and they all agreed and said the same thing. I just don't think anyone has thought to mention it before. Maybe someone from Intercontinental Hotels will read this and change the design going forward.

Reviews.Title: “First time at a Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: Cubechick
Reviews.Content: I have to say that my stay was a pleasant one. I was there for three nights on business. My room was clean and spacious. I had a sitting area with a small sofa and a small microwave and fridge at my disposal. At check-in I was greeted with a plate of cookies as well as a gift bag with a bottle of water, a granola bar, and a bag of Doritos. Nice touch. The computer system was down when I checked in, but they verified my reservation off of a checklist and just asked that I come back later to provide a credit card and sign in. They really kept the inconvenience down to a minumum. The complimentary breakfast was hot and plentiful. My only complaint was the lack of a restaurant and bar on the premises. They do have a Chili's restaurant in the parking lot, but they closed rather early as it's in a business district.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: tattuproductions
Reviews.Content: First, I want to give a warm thank you to two of your professional staff members, Cece & Ester for the warmth and courtesy both of you have shown me. In my opinion, a hotel is just a room. It's the supporting cast the makes one feel at home and that's what I felt while I was here. The room was very clean, but what I appreciate most when traveling is peace and quiet and I got just that. Whenever I come to San diego, this will definitely be my first choice in accommodations. Thank you once again. I highly recommend it to any travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: riskman
Reviews.Content: We went to Del Mar to watch the ponies and stayed over at this hotel. It is located in a corporate area which is a plus and a minus. On the plus side, very little traffic noise, on the minus not much around it as far as restaurants. There was a small shopping center but everything was closed for the weekend. We drove into La Jolla which was pretty close and found a really good Italian restaurant and a great pizza place. The staff was freindly and accommodating. Get to the breakfast early, this room filled up with no place to sit. The room itself was clean and large, almost like a suite.There was even a microwave and a double dorm size fridge. There was plenty of parking. Internet speeds were on the slow end but I have noticed that lately at Holiday Inn express hotels. I now bring my own broadband2go with me to avoid it. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Etrnlife
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It is in a business park area, so it felt very safe and uncrowded. It's about 15-20 minutes from the Sea World area of San Diego. The hotel itself is very clean and service was excellent. Our room was spacious and comfortable with a king bed, armchair, flatscreen t.v. and computer desk. Free Parking, Wifi and breakfast buffet is also included. I would stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: KW1011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as my the headquarters for my new employer are just down the road. Front desk staff is very friendly and accommodating. They asked for my email at check-in in case I were to forget something in my room, they could easily notify me after I left - never experienced that before! The rooms are spacious, new and very clean. The "business center" is just a slow computer on a desk, but it's free to print things out and there is free wifi at the hotel as well. The hot breakfast is great since there isn't really anything within walking distance. I'm thankful that this place is so clean, nice and well-staffed as I will be staying here several times a year.

Reviews.Title: “Good business find but not for families”
Reviews.Author: GlobalPassion
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the positive reviews on this sight, but it didn't fulfill my expectations. The front desk personnel were amazing, so that was a giant plus and we came in early enough to grab the fantastic cookies BUT the facility was showing some signs of difficulty. (front doors would not shut, and the the elevator carpet was severely stained...not good first impression!) I wanted to "treat" my mother, but she complained all the way up to the room. The room itself was nice. Nothing to complain about here. And Holiday Inn does have some good beds. If you want to primarily get sleep, this is an excellent facility. However, if you want to "hang out" with your family or friends, there really is not good place to do that. The pool area was stark and very small. The breakfast was actually exceptional. small touches made it great. That is why I say for business this is perfect...good sleep, good breakfast and quiet because it is in a business park. But for my picky mother---not good enough!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice up to date rooms with great service.”
Reviews.Author: Coolguy_7
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and modern. The free breakfast was satisfying for adults and children. The pool was nice and fun, larger than most. Hot tub was spacious, felt very nice after a long day of walking. It is about 25 minutes from downtown and other main attractions but it is great value and our family would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Renovated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: morphius909
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 2 night stay at HIX-Sorrento Valley. The Front Desk Clerk, I can't remember her name, was amazing. Very warm and informative,and as a Gold Priority Club Member, I was given a gift (chips, water, candy, chocolate bars, etc). Which was great, as last year I was a PC platinum and not once was I offered anything! The rooms themselves are fairly nice but you can definitely tell they have been remodeled, and they look and feel remodeled a few years ago. A couple of pet peeves I noticed here: -No Bathroom fans, just those passive ones which I don't know do anything -They don't vacuum daily -Slow Draining "drains" The stay is far from anywhere so make sure you have a car! Son and wife tried out the pool and said it was good. Overall a good stay with just some minor nuances!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel, but far from everything, need a car”
Reviews.Author: Lucymydoggie
Reviews.Content: I always try to stay with holiday inn express when I am on vacation because of their excellent, consistent service and quality. This hotel did not disappoint, it was new, clean and the staff was so friendly. Breakfast was delicious, my family really enjoyed it. The only reason I did not give full 5 points for the hotel was the location; you need to drive to go everywhere. There is nothing nearby, except Chilis restaurant. The price is really attractive compared to the other hotels located nearer to San Diego attractions like La Jolla, Seaworld, downtown San Diego. I would recommend this hotel if you have a car and are prepared to drive a little.

Reviews.Title: “No help from the front desk...”
Reviews.Author: RJSP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a reasonably-priced San Diego hotel close to a lot of great places to visit in the area. Big mistake! There were a bunch of teen-aged girl basketball players staying here for a tournament in town. The whole time we were there, both day and night, the girls (and their chaperones/mothers too, some help they were) were going back and forth between their multiple rooms and making a lot of noise in the hallways. All of them closed their security bars (the little levers on the upper parts of their doors) with their doors open so that when their doors would swing shut, they would hit the security bars instead of latching. No big deal, except that every time one of the relatively-heavy doors was let go, it hit the bar and made a loud banging noise. This went on with minimal pauses in between bangs for most of the night and the whole time we were in the room during the days we were there. I called down to the front desk and asked them to please do something about it as we were very tired and needed to get some sleep. The clerk was very nice and said he would take care of it, but nothing changed. I finally asked one of the mothers to please quiet down, but she just stared back at me and kept on with the noisiness. The message the hotel sent by allowing this behavior to continue uninterrupted is that all other guests are at the mercy of the behavior of the worst-behaved guests, whoever they might be. Another, smaller inconvenience was that one of the lights was burned out in the bathroom. It made it so dim in there, I couldn't really see well enough to do normal grooming in the bathroom. On our way out the front door after our first night there, I asked the very nice clerk at the front desk to please have someone replace the burned out bulb. He said he would take care of it, but it was still burned out as of when we checked out of the hotel the next day. When I first asked about it, he said something about not knowing whether they had any light bulbs on hand (???!). When he saw us the next day, he asked whether we had been given the bulb he found for us. I said no, and he expressed disbelief that the people to whom he had given the bulb hadn't given it to me. It's hard for me to understand why they didn't just change the light bulb. That seems to me like just a normal part of room maintenance. The bottom line for me is that in spite of their very cheerful and pleasant attitudes, the people at the front desk were unable to provide assistance with respect to these two issues. I did receive prompt help when I needed to log into their computer to print my boarding pass the morning we checked out, which I appreciated. It would have been nice if we could have had a couple of nights' sleep and could have relaxed a bit during the day instead of leaving feeling tense and sleep-deprived.

Reviews.Title: “Found this hotel on a discount site...”
Reviews.Author: hppygilmore
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on a discount site. Booked a room for 4 people for two nights. When we arrived I was told that they had us in a room that had 1 king bed for 4 people. After a bit of discussion they solved the problem for us. Moved us to a room with two beds. The clerks at the hotel are extremely nice. Each morning while we were eating our free breakfast, they would come around and speak to the guests. Made you feel like they enjoyed having you as a guest and not just a $ sign. The breakfast consists of: eggs, bacon, toast, cereal, juices, cinnamon rolls and various other items. The scrambled eggs are not the best but everything else is good. There is a Chili's in the same parking lot. All other food options are a bit of a drive. The hotel is located in a business/industrial area. The rooms are nicely furnished and clean. The pool and spa are very nice and good for small children. If you can get this hotel for a good price don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wannabjetsetter
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the Holiday Inn Express Sorrento Valley. The only negative is that it's about 14 miles from downtown San Diego, so you definitely do need a car in order to stay. However the driving distance to all the sights is perfectly reasonable, especially to La Jolla and Torrey Pines. Room was large with large bathroom, clean, and lots of storage space. Area seemed to be a business park area and was therefore quiet. Unfortunately, the pool was being renovated while we were there so it was closed but we wouldn't have used it anyway. Breakfast was typical continental breakfast, cereal, milk, juices, bagels, buscuits, eggs. My husband didn't like the egg's but I was perfectly fine with everything. Very nice and good value, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vanilla27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely no-frills, but is truly ideal for someone looking for a clean, simple stay with all your basic amenities at a very good price. The room is spacious, the internet free, and the breakfast buffet decent. We found the employees to all be friendly and attentive. My only complaint was that housekeeping only appeared to clean rooms in the morning. Having slept in, we missed the morning housekeeper's rounds. Gone all afternoon, we found our room uncleaned when we returned in the evening. It should also be noted that Mira Mesa is not a particularly "happening" part of town. But the hotel is well-located to the freeway and beaches, shopping, and nightlife aren't more than 15-20 minutes away. Would definitely stay here again for a well-priced, satisfying visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and would come back again”
Reviews.Author: StuckOnThe50
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the front and back end of a business trip. Great location off of Highway 805. The hotel is about 12 miles north of downtown San Diego. Large King size room with dresser, desk, flat screen tv and free wifi. Room was clean and had rooms on the second floor which were quiet. Comp. hot breakfast in the morning which consist of eggs, bread, breakfast meat, cereal, juice, fruit, coffee, milk, yogurt. Outdoor swimming pool, fitness center and business center (took a peek but did not use) Free parking but lot does get full around dinner time as the hotel shares a lot with a restaurant (Chili's). Numerous eating locations/retail strip mall east down Mira Mesa Blvd. All are within a 5-10 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “The customer service you receive will WOW you!”
Reviews.Author: Edith_SanDiego
Reviews.Content: Clean; in a business area but very close to San Diego attractions; Front desk personnel very helpful and friendly; new HI Express upgrades; great breakfast variety; everyone says hello and smiles.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bidibidi
Reviews.Content: W e stayed at this Holiday Inn during November. From the time I called to inquire about the hotel till we left, we had great service. The young man that answered the phone provided needed information to plan our trip. Sheril, the front desk attendant and breakfast server, provided excellent service. She knew us by name by the next day. The Manager, Ms. Santos, also made sure everyone was well attended. The rooms were large. The beds were comfortable and nice size restroom. Free wi fi was available. It was also quiet. We were there on business so the amenities made our stay enjoyable. This is a great hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommend!”
Reviews.Author: janet0243
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked through Hotwire, so we actually had no choice of hotel...After reading Aug. 2009 review, I was very worried about our stay. We were pleasantly surprised that all negative remarks, were not our experience. We arrived very early @ 3:45 a.m. to a smiling and cordial receptionist. In fact, all personnel we came into contact with, were very pleasant and helpful. We were with our daughter and her family for a grandson's wedding and had booked 2 rooms, Wed. to Sunday. Both rooms were on 4th floor at opposite ends of hall near stairways. The rooms were clean and quiet. Queen beds were very comfortable. Newspaper at door most every morning. WIFI in room a little slow, but nice addition. Decent continental breakfast. Family enjoyed relaxing in outside hot tub every evening to end our days. Great restaurant across parking lot. Very close to major freeways for easy access to many attractions. Only complaint, no in room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 1happydisneygirl
Reviews.Content: Let me first start off by saying that my family and I LOVE the Ichotel chain and stay at the Holiday Inn Express hotels as often as we can when traveling. That is why it is difficult for me to write such a negative review. RESERVATIONS: Booked 2 rooms on-line using my Priority Club membership. Quick and easy. Requested adjoining rooms for our 2 day stay. ARRIVAL: Upon our late Friday night arrival, we were greeted by a friendly, if not lonely and overworked young man. When he told us our rooms were on different floors, I asked him if he could please put my parents and us next to one another or at least on the same floor. He advised us that the hotel had been sold out for the weekend and there were no more rooms available. My first impression of the hotel was that it looked as if HI had purchased the property from another hotel chain as it didn't seem to have the layout of the newer HI hotels. ROOMS: My parents were in a king room on the 2nd floor. My hubby, teenaged daughter and I were in a 2 queen 4th floor room. We had a room at the very end of the hallway. The minute we stepped into our room, we knew things weren't "right." All 3 of our family members noticed an "off" smell. Something like chemicals. As I headed over to the bed, I noticed that the bed skirt was FILTHY. We looked down and saw what appeared to be a combination of chocolate, blood, white "stuff" (dried milk?) and perhaps body fluids. All of these things were splattered over the entire right side of the bedskirt. Then we noticed all the dust and the food-smudged dresser tops. It was obvious no one had dusted or cleaned in days. My husband decided to use the bathrom and when he walked in, found blue spatters all over the toilet seat. Then he noticed the vanity was dirty and sticky. We were appalled, but realized we couldn't move because there were no other rooms available. After settling in, my husband sat down to get onto the wireless internet. It wasn't working. As we attempted to call down to the front desk, we realized we couldn't. (Though we could call out and to our parents room.) There was no other phone in the room. So, I went downstairs to talk to the front desk and was told that the internet wasn't working AND our phone was broken and they would have it fixed. (Which they never did.) As we settled into bed, the noise began and we could hear everything...the banging of doors, the people in the next room. The baby crying at 2 a.m. in the morning. Very thin walls. The next day, we got up to take a shower and it dawned on us that the bathroom vanity was located inside the bathroom which really limited our use. Also, there was no fan, so the bathroom was completely fogged up. There were the typical HI amenities...blow dryer, shampoo, soap, etc. Plenty of plush towels. Our beds were fairly comfortable, though one of the top blankets provided had hair all over it. Our room had a refrigerator and t.v., but no microwave like the other HI hotels where we have stayed. My parents room had no refrigerator or microwave. When I made the reservation, it said they would have a refrigerator since my mom has medication she has to keep cold. She had to keep her meds in our room. No big deal, but rather an inconvenience. It also got very stuffy at night and there was no window to open. Since the air conditioner was loud, we had to leave it off. BREAKFAST: The complimentary breakfast was a little disappointing. They had the same menu both days: cereal, bagels, toast, cinnamon rolls, sausage, yogurt, tea, coffee, oj, hard boiled eggs. The bananas were green and the yogurt was the "lite" stuff that tastes fake. All HI hotels I've stayed in have both regular and lite yogurt and more fruit offerings. Also, the coffee ran out and my dad had to take the coffee containers back to the breakfast room staff to get it refilled. FACILITIES: I used the business center and it was very nice. Fast internet, along with a printer and maybe even a fax? The hotel had a FABULOUS pool and hottub located outside with plenty of seating. However, when we went to get pool towels, they had ran out and we were given small hand towels to use. This hotel is located in a business district, which I didn't realize when I made the reservation. No problem at all, but there is only 1 restaurant (Chili's) located a few feet from the front of the hotel. So, if you prefer to stay in a more "active" area, this hotel is not suggested. OVERALL: Housekeeping needs some serious help. We left a note and asked them to change the bedskirt, which they never did. Also, while we were attending the wedding reception on Saturday, I got a phone call from the hotel desk clerk asking us why we hadn't removed our stuff from our room. I told them it was because we had a reservation for 2 nights. She was very nice, but very confused. After looking us up on their computer, she realized an error had been made and apologized for the inconvenience. I didn't get mad and had to laugh. It just seem to add to the unusual experience we were having at the hotel. Based on other reviews, I'm wondering if we just had one of those stays where everything goes wrong. However maybe this HI needs some seroius help. Though staff was nice, I won't stay here again when we return for the next family event. At $153 a weekend night, I will go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated...Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sophie832
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights, from June 26-28, in Room #413 at the Sorrento Holiday Inn. Our room couldn't have been better! The fourth floor is newly renovated, with new carpeting, wallpaper, and furnishings. There was a vaulted ceiling at our window, which made the room seem even bigger. The choice of a soft or firm pillow was also nice. The flat-screen TV had 50+ channels, which is unusual for a hotel. The new furniture and carpet was very nice. The front-desk staff were very helpful! We forgot our toothbrushes, and they had complimentary ones available (as well as toothpaste, razors, etc.). On our last night, we asked if we could store some dinner leftovers in their fridge (no in-room fridge), and they happily obliged. I used the fitness center on 2 occasions, both at off-peak times, so I was by myself. My only complaint about the hotel might be that the fitness center didn't have an elliptical machine. There are 2 treadmills, an exercise bike, and a weight machine. The TV is first come, first served in the sense that it has a remote, and whomever has that will control what is being watched. We didn't use the pool/jacuzzi, but it looked nice. We did have free breakfast every morning downstairs. I would say the breakfast was so-so, but since it was free, I can't complain. There is a small selection of hot dishes (changed with each day), cereal, toast, yogurt, cinnamon buns, danishes, and of course coffee and juice. It was definitely a nice way to start the day. Parking was never a huge problem. The hotel shares its parking lot with a Chili's restaurant (convenient for dinner) and there is another hotel in the same general area, but we found parking spots each night when we returned. Since we'd only paid $88 a night, we really didn't expect much other than your basic Holiday Inn. What we got was excellent service and a really nice room. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Your Wedding Guests”
Reviews.Author: CACSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reserved a room block of fifty room-nights at this hotel for most of the out-of-town guests attending our wedding in La Jolla in August 2008. We chose this hotel because of the location and price: not terribly far from La Jolla and a price that our friends and family could afford. If you are familiar with the Holiday Inn Express brand, this hotel delivers: my husband and I always choose this brand all over the country and it has never failed us to deliver clean and quiet odor-free rooms, comfortable bedding, functional and free internet, and a reasonable price. Note we do NOT choose this brand for the food - just go find a Denny's or McDonald's if you're on a budget but you need to eat in the morning. I want to call out the fantastic service the manager, Ken, provided us (in making the arrangements) and our family (in serving their needs during their stay.) Ken is service-oriented, friendly, and produced excellent results. All the feedback from my family about this hotel, especially Ken and his staff, was quite positive. Be aware that the hotel is near enough to MCAS Miramar that you will very much hear the jets if they are flying. The jets do observe a curfew, so if this is a concern for you I'd discuss it with the manager to get the details before you book. None of our guests complained to us that the noise was a problem. If you are in the market for an informal hotel in this part of San Diego, I would highly recommend this Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “I love Holiday Inns!”
Reviews.Author: secretagentangie
Reviews.Content: I have had a wonderful experience with all of the Holiday Inns (Express included) in San Diego, and there is not much else I can really add besides how clean it is, how great the little extras are (the shampoo, conditioner, lotion... how cute are they?!), and how nicely presented the rooms are. Also, nothing is more awesome than free wifi in your room! SWEET! I look forward to staying in many more!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family of 4!”
Reviews.Author: TheCaptainsWife
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our family of 4. The pull-out sofa was just right for our 2 daughters who are 4 and 8 and the king bed was heavenly. A pillow-top mattress with a collection of soft and firm pillows from which to choose and a fluffy duvet-my husband and I couldn't wait to get in that bed every night. The housekeeper did a nice job of cleaning and providing enough towels every day. We spent a lot of time in the heated pool. It could use a little repainting along the edges but otherwise again, it was just perfect for a family. I love spas but this one was kept pretty hot so I could only sit on the steps for a few minutes before I had to get back out. The breakfast is good. There are hot foods and cold and of course the HIE cinnamon rolls. Our children loved picking out what they wanted to eat. Every afternoon at the desk the staff provided hot freshly baked cranberry and white chocolate chunk cookies. That was a nice treat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: jcobb
Reviews.Content: The HIE in Sorrento Valley has one of the best staffs I have ever dealt with. Always pleasant and willing to help. Property is clean and in good condition; well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Fanatic714
Reviews.Content: I got a really great deal for $56/night for 2 queen beds from the San Diego Chamber of Commerce. If you have a car, this is a really great place to stay. It's not too far away from downtown (around 15-20 minutes away from everything). This is a great place to stay, especially if you are on a budget. It's in a very nice business/residential area. The decor is simple but modern. The comforters are very soft & white. The staff is very friendly. This is a new, small, simple nice hotel so don't expect lots of amenities like a big large pool etc. There is a small pool though. Considering that I'm from So-Cal and used to live in SD, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Family of 5”
Reviews.Author: tsmb02
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel. Our family of 5 (3 teenage daughters) fit in the 2Q room with the sleeper sofa with room to spare. Very large rooms. Very clean. Friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast very good. Hotel was in a nice location and a very short ride to Sea World. Would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: sulkygirl
Reviews.Content: I'm starting to like the Holiday Inn Express brand more and more. Each time I stay at one, they seem to improve. This hotel is close to many San Diego attractions. We had no idea where Sorrento Valley was, and it turned out to be a very short drive to our destination - Comic Con 2007. The hotel is clean and well run. The pool area is nothing spectacular, but it is clean and comfortable and the kids enjoyed it none the less. The room was clean and good sized. The beds were wonderful, as were the sheets and their new European comforters (sheets betwen the comforter, thus eliminating the scary polyester bedspreads). Mattresses and pillows were great, with the exception of the pull-out sofabed mattress, which was awful and old. We mentioned this to the manager and he said that they were going to get new mattresses next month. Always love the H.I.E. breakfast. Fruit, cereal, hot cinnamon buns, croissants and danish, hard boiled eggs --- and this one even had bacon and egg omelets. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Gomore
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised when we arrived at this hotel at how nice and clean it was. We had a suite and it was very roomy!! Very comfy beds! Friendly staff and free breakfast. A good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...very happy”
Reviews.Author: TaliaT
Reviews.Content: We arrived later in the evening but were greeted by two people at the front desk. We asked them for a restaurant in the area and they pointed us in the right direction to a few places. The location is quiet, tough to find some restaurants close by, but overall an ideal spot to be able to reach most places in the San Diego area. We visited Sea World and Del Mar while there and they were both within a ten minute drive. Rooms were clean, service was great. Staff was friendly. Lots of towels and super comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel (but be prepared to listen to the nearby Marine Corps airstation!)”
Reviews.Author: M_DiLoreto
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable hotel, conveniently located near dining, shopping and theaters. Staff was friendly and helpful; pool and fitness room were clean and well-maintained. Parking lot tends to fill up at Lunch and Dinner time (due to the Chilis restaraunt located on the premises), so don't expect to find parking if you arrive during the lunch/dinner rush. Expect alot of flyovers by Marine Corps aircraft from nearby MCAS Miramar. Overall, a very pleasant and positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: elkejames
Reviews.Content: Just remember, you get what you pay for! Hotel was packed and loud both nights we stayed there. The first morning I awoke to what sounded like elephants or some other raucous mammals dancing on the ceiling. Pool was always full of people. The gym was nice--not crowded because everyone was in the pool. The breakfast was good, however, on our second morning they kept running out of food and we had to wait for a vacant table. Screaming young children at other tables did not make for a relaxing breakfast either. The room was of decent size. Internet access was great. The beds.....I could actually feel the springs on my very sqeaky bed (it was so hideous, it was funny). The sheets and towels were thread barren, the pillows flat. The decor was tired looking. Only one ice machine was working which was a floor below us. The hotel offered coin laundry which I took advantage of.....I spent a lot of time in the laundry room guarding the only washer/dryer in working order (the other one was broken). The maid did not fill up our coffee or replace glasses after our first night. Chilis next door is apparently the hip hangout for the local drunks seeking to let loose after work/school.....we communicated with the waitress via yelling. After driving several miles to the nearest grocery store, I circled the hotel parking lot for a spot to park. 10 minutes later, a loud carload from Chilis left...this was very annoying, since I was a hotel guest but had nowhere to park. The hotel was ok, average. I would not stay here again though. I think for a few bucks more, you can weed out the riff raff.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite for S.D. Business Travel !!”
Reviews.Author: gogirl7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here almost every Sunday night for business purposes. By far the best for less in San Diego !! The rooms are always fresh and clean and the front desk girl at this hotel is very helpful and friendly, all the time and every time. This is a great mid-price hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great room! even though I slept on the couch bed it was very comfy, located right next to Chili's. I would stay here again and again!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express San Diego-Sorrento Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 5925 Lusk Boulevard, San Diego, CA 92121
